intro: Galium apricum var. aristatum, commonly known as the slender woodcricket, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain minute seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
